intro: Colinil roseum, commonly known as the rose of Sharon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, velvety texture, while its flowers come in shades of white, pink, and purple. Colinil roseum is native to parts of Asia and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
